document_data.name: Broken Crown Inn
document_data.mainbody: The '''Broken Crown Inn''' was an inn found on the [[High Road]] north of [[Neverwinter]] on the [[Sword Coast North]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].<ref name="D&D.N>
document_data.Location: The inn was situated just off the High Road and not far inland from [[Raven Cliff Beach]] and the ruins of [[Cragmire Keep]] and [[Angelhead Mine]].<ref name="D&D.N />
document_data.Structure:
[[File:Broken Crown Inn rear.jpg|thumb|right|250px|''The water wheel behind the Broken Crown. No, we can't explain it either.'']]
The Broken Crown Inn was rather modest in size: it was two stories tall and did not boast many rooms, though parts of it were incomplete and under construction. The building was timber framed, with stone-brick walls on the ground floor and plastered walls on the upper floor, while the roof had wooden shingles. The ground floor was given over to a taproom, while the upper floor had a few rooms for guests.<ref name="D&D.N />

In front of the inn was a well and behind it was a water wheel that emptied into a nearby pond, though the source of the water and its purpose and function are unknown.<ref name="D&D.N />
document_data.Services: In addition to room and board, the inn was a decent enough place to find work. Bounty officers could be found staying at the inn, offering recompense for those who helped rid the area of [[bandit]]s and other criminals.<ref name="D&D.N />
document_data.History:
[[File:Broken Crown Sign.jpg|thumb|right|''The sign of the Broken Crown, itself broken.'']]
Its first owner was a sympathizer of [[Luskan]] who believed the rulers of [[Neverwintan]] should be overthrown, hence the name "Broken Crown".<ref name="D&D.N />

Some time in the 1470s [[DR]], the inn was purchased and re-opened by Gorun Pricebreaker, a [[dwarf]] merchant who sought to profit from the re-emerging trade traffic that had sprung up along the High Road.<ref name="D&D.N />

''Circa'' the {{YearlinkName|1479}}, the inn became a hub of activity for [[adventurer]]s, [[Harpers]], and others who were taking actions against the [[Blackdagger Bandits]] that had taken over the ruins of [[Cragmire Keep]] and preyed on caravans on the High Road.<ref name="D&D.N />
